file_content.text: Better get outta here in a hurry--before the boys find out what you did.
Hmph. At least he didn't make a fuss. I hate it when they make a fuss.
You got some skill breaking through Fa'athra's line, and some nerve coming in here. Do I know you?
This old gangster Brell said you were a friend of his.
Don't mean to intrude.
Yeah, I remember Brell. He wants his brother back, don't he? Well, I can't help.
I don't have time for this. I'm here for the Brell kid.
Let's make this quick.
With that attitude, you're going to get to know my fist real well.
Are you picking a fight?
Hey, just being careful. Ain't trying to pick a fight.
We got enough trouble with cowards and traitors in our ranks without having to deal with strangers breaking in.
Just don't let it happen again. Now tell me--is there a kid named Brell in your gang?
I'll let it go this time.
You should watch how you talk to people. Anyway, I'm looking for a kid named Brell.
Just be more careful.
It's best you don't get in my way. I'm looking for a kid named Brell, and you're going to help me.
Oh, I can make it much worse.
What do you want with him? You working for Fa'athra, too?
His brother sent me to get him out of the gang.
I work for the kid's family.
Lew sent you, huh. I wish I could say that made things different, but it just don't work that way.
Don't make up stories.
Okay, all right--I guess I believe you. At least, you don't look like you work for them.
Look, I don't care one bit about Nem'ro or Fa'athra. I work for myself, and you're going to give me the Brell kid.
I work for me.
Sorry, buddy, I can't do that.
The Brell kid's a traitor. First time Fa'athra's thugs start shooting at us, he turns coward and tries to join their side.
Nem'ro's gonna have a lot of questions for him, and I can't let him go.
Trust me. You don't want to cause trouble here.
Start a fight and you'll lose.
Now we can do this the easy way or the hard way.
I have a job to do.
Let's talk it through.
You're right. We're civilized people, aren't we?
His big brother isn't going to like that--and believe me, you don't want to mess with him.
My employer won't approve.
Then he shoulda come here himself.
Look, I don't wanna make trouble. So how about I pay you some credits and you go on your way.
Tell Brell's big brother you got here too late or something. You'll be richer, and this weasel will get what he has coming.
Hey, credits are credits. I'm not picky.
Fine, keep him and pay up.
Y'hear that, Brell? Your savior's just been bought.
Hope you did everything you wanted to do in this life. Because once Nem'ro's through with you, you're done.
No, please. Please!
Stop snivelling, you moron.
Here, take your credits--and good luck dealing with big brother.
I have a better idea: You let Brell go, he and his brother leave Hutta for good, and nobody knows any different.
No. Let him go.
What am I supposed to tell the boys? Turn coward and get a free pass off Hutta?
That kind of deal's no good for morale.
Tell them you shot him--or he escaped.
Then lie.
They'll never go for it--but it looks like you're not leaving me with much choice.
I don't care.
You're not gonna give me a choice, are you?
You work with me or I shoot you in the face.
Would you rather get shot?
All right, all right!
Looks like you got lucky, Brell. Your big brother's hired muscle just saved your skin.
Th--thank you!
You better get outta here, too. The boys won't be happy when they find out what you did.
I'm sorry, do I know you?
